relevant_findings.lungs: Poor air movement throughout, minimal basilar rales, no wheezes or rhonchi
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.abdominal: Quiet bowel sounds present, mildly distended, diffusely tender, especially in RUQ and epigastrium, +guarding, especially in areas of maximal tenderness
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, trace bilateral edema
relevant_findings.neurological: A+Ox3. CN II-XII intact. Moving all extremities.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient complained of abdominal pain. Denied nausea but had 2 episodes of non-bloody emesis. Initially had shortness of breath but now feels breathing is at baseline.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's shortness of breath initially present but improved to baseline after intervention.
